intro: Exacum bicolor, commonly known as the twin-flower or double-flower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that often appear in pairs. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. Exacum bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a potted plant.
